title: Power Supply Engineer and Engineering Technicians NEW!
full_description: Engineers must have direct design experience with a strong background in Power or Power electronics. Salary commensurate with experience. Engineering Technician is responsible for troubleshooting, repairing, and testing power supplies and related equipment. Use of electronic devices, electronic loads, power supplies, computers, software, and hardware is assumed.Duties include component level troubleshooting and repair of linear and switched mode power supplies, UPS systems, printed circuit boards, electronic loads, and other related equipment. Candidates must have an Associates of Applied Science or equivalent work experience in an electronic repair or electronic device manufacturing environment. Basic through-hole and surface mount soldering techniques are requited. Ability to manage multiple repair projects and write best practice repair and test procedures will be a plus. Calibration, design experience, or Lab View knowledge would be huge. Excel, C+, or Basic programming skills are also a plus. Power supply design experience will be required for degreed or non-degreed Engineers.Benefits include Salary, Paid Holidays, Health Insurance, Retirement planning, and Profit Sharing Bonuses.
